item.content:encoded:
StorPunk Project Official Launch

We're excited to announce the official launch of the StorPunk project - a decentralized storage network built on cypherpunk, voluntaryist, and agorist principles of voluntary exchange and free trade.

Phase 0: Foundation Building

Our current phase focuses on:

  • Website and community development
  • DAO constitution and governance framework
  • Technical specifications and architecture planning
  • Community engagement through encrypted channels

What Makes StorPunk Different

StorPunk implements temporary, configurable data storage with:

  • User-defined data expiration periods
  • Censorship-resistant architecture
  • Self-custody wallet integration
  • Dual-network client supporting both StorPunk and Autonomi
  • Decentralized exchange capabilities

item.content:encoded:
Privacy-First Community Infrastructure

Staying true to our cypherpunk principles, StorPunk community communications operate through encrypted, decentralized channels.

Retroshare Over Tor

Our primary community platform uses Retroshare, a decentralized social sharing network that provides:

  • End-to-end encrypted communications
  • No central servers or corporate dependencies
  • Resistance to censorship and surveillance
  • Anonymous participation options

Code Collaboration via Radicle

For technical development, we use Radicle - a peer-to-peer, decentralized code collaboration platform:

  • Sovereign code repositories without central authorities
  • Censorship-resistant development workflow
  • Local-first with offline functionality
  • Cryptographic identity and authentication

Getting Connected

To join our community discussions and contribute to development:

  1. Download and install Retroshare from retroshare.cc
  2. Configure it to run over Tor for enhanced privacy
  3. Add our Project Coordinator as a friend using the provided node ID
  4. Access our community forums and development channels

This approach ensures that community members and developers can participate with complete privacy and anonymity as they choose, supporting voluntaryist principles of voluntary association without coercion or surveillance.

item.title: Technical Architecture: Temporary Storage Meets Cypherpunk Principles
item.description: Deep dive into StorPunk's technical approach - how temporary data storage, dual-network architecture, and decentralized exchange create a comprehensive privacy-preserving ecosystem supporting agorist counter-economics and voluntaryist free trade.
item.content:encoded:
Technical Innovation for Digital Freedom and Economic Sovereignty

StorPunk's architecture combines proven decentralized storage concepts with innovative approaches to temporary data lifecycle and integrated exchange capabilities, enabling agorist counter-economics and voluntaryist free trade principles.

Temporary Storage Model

Unlike permanent storage networks, StorPunk focuses on configurable, temporary data retention:

  • User-Defined TTL: Clients specify exact data retention periods
  • Automatic Expiration: Data disappears completely after the specified time
  • Economic Efficiency: Storage costs directly tied to actual usage duration
  • Privacy Enhancement: Minimal persistent digital footprints

Dual-Network Architecture

StorPunk clients provide unified access to both storage paradigms:

  • StorPunk Network: Temporary, efficient storage for ephemeral data
  • Autonomi Integration: Permanent storage capabilities through the same interface
  • Seamless Operation: Users choose storage type based on data requirements
  • Token Flexibility: Support for both $PUNK and ANT tokens

Integrated Exchange Systems

Two distinct decentralized exchange implementations:

Native Currency Exchange (Launch Feature)

  • Direct $PUNK token trading with fiat and cryptocurrencies
  • Node-based multisig security for trade verification
  • No central points of failure or intermediaries
  • Privacy-preserving transaction mechanisms

General Trading Platform (Post-Launch)

  • Decentralized marketplace for goods and services
  • Censorship-resistant commerce infrastructure
  • Private, anonymous transaction capabilities
  • Alternative to traditional controlled marketplaces
  • Support for agorist counter-economics and voluntary exchange
  • Free trade without government interference or restrictions

Privacy Through Architecture

StorPunk implements privacy at the protocol level rather than relying on policy promises:

  • Client-Side Encryption: Data encrypted before transmission
  • Network Hops: Anonymous usage capabilities similar to Tor
  • Self-Custody: Users maintain complete control of keys and data
  • Minimal Metadata: Reduced tracking and surveillance opportunities

This technical approach creates practical tools for digital sovereignty and economic freedom that ordinary users can access and benefit from, supporting voluntaryist principles of individual liberty and free market exchange.
